New Records: Shohei Ohtani hit his 53rd home run and recorded 55 stolen bases in the season.
The Dodgers combined for a season-high 17 strikeouts in the game.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani tied the game in the ninth inning with a home run.
Mookie Betts hit a walk-off home run to end the game.
Seth Halvorsen earned his first career save with a strong performance.
Pre-Game Insights: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts highlighted Shohei Ohtani's performance as exceptional.
Yoshinobu Yamamoto, returning from injury, was expected to be a key starter in the playoffs.
Post-Match Reflections: Mookie Betts expressed excitement about the upcoming series against the Padres.
Rockies manager expressed frustration with early opportunities missed.
Max Muncy was out of the starting lineup due to soreness.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Dodger Stadium with an attendance of 50,730.
The victory kept the Dodgers in a strong position for the division title.
Others: The game was played on September 22, 2024, at 8:10 PM PDT.
The Rockies needed three wins in their last six games to avoid a second consecutive 100-loss season.
